Our 2010 PLOS Genetics paper on RAD-seq has been recognized as one of the 10 most cited papers in the journal's first decade!

This recognition celebrates the transformative impact of our work developing and applying Restriction site-Associated DNA sequencing (RAD-seq) for population genomics, which has revolutionized the field of evolutionary genetics and enabled genomic studies in non-model organisms worldwide.

## The Landmark Paper

Our 2010 publication introduced:
- RAD-seq methodology refinements
- Population genomics applications
- Stickleback genome mapping
- Linkage map construction
- Evolutionary insights

Being top 10 means:
